001package org.jsoup.nodes;
002
003import org.jsoup.SerializationException;
004import org.jsoup.helper.DataUtil;
005import org.jsoup.internal.StringUtil;
006import org.jsoup.helper.Validate;
007import org.jsoup.nodes.Document.OutputSettings;
008import org.jsoup.parser.CharacterReader;
009import org.jsoup.parser.Parser;
010
011import java.io.IOException;
012import java.nio.charset.Charset;
013import java.nio.charset.CharsetEncoder;
014import java.util.Arrays;
015import java.util.HashMap;
016
017import static org.jsoup.nodes.Document.OutputSettings.*;
018import static org.jsoup.nodes.Entities.EscapeMode.base;
019import static org.jsoup.nodes.Entities.EscapeMode.extended;
020
021/**
022 * HTML entities, and escape routines. Source: <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/named-character-references.html#named-character-references">W3C
023 * HTML named character references</a>.
024 */
025public class Entities {
026    // constants for escape options:
027    static final int ForText = 0x1;
028    static final int ForAttribute = 0x2;
029    static final int Normalise = 0x4;
030    static final int TrimLeading = 0x8;
031    static final int TrimTrailing = 0x10;
032
033    private static final int empty = -1;
034    private static final String emptyName = "";
035    static final int codepointRadix = 36;
036    private static final char[] codeDelims = {',', ';'};
037    private static final HashMap<String, String> multipoints = new HashMap<>(); // name -> multiple character references
038
039    public enum EscapeMode {
040        /**
041         * Restricted entities suitable for XHTML output: lt, gt, amp, and quot only.
042         */
043        xhtml(EntitiesData.xmlPoints, 4),
044        /**
045         * Default HTML output entities.
046         */
047        base(EntitiesData.basePoints, 106),
048        /**
049         * Complete HTML entities.
050         */
051        extended(EntitiesData.fullPoints, 2125);
052
053        // table of named references to their codepoints. sorted so we can binary search. built by BuildEntities.
054        private String[] nameKeys;
055        private int[] codeVals; // limitation is the few references with multiple characters; those go into multipoints.
056
057        // table of codepoints to named entities.
058        private int[] codeKeys; // we don't support multicodepoints to single named value currently
059        private String[] nameVals;
060
061        EscapeMode(String file, int size) {
062            load(this, file, size);
063        }
064
065        int codepointForName(final String name) {
066            int index = Arrays.binarySearch(nameKeys, name);
067            return index >= 0 ? codeVals[index] : empty;
068        }
069
070        String nameForCodepoint(final int codepoint) {
071            final int index = Arrays.binarySearch(codeKeys, codepoint);
072            if (index >= 0) {
073                // the results are ordered so lower case versions of same codepoint come after uppercase, and we prefer to emit lower
074                // (and binary search for same item with multi results is undefined
075                return (index < nameVals.length - 1 && codeKeys[index + 1] == codepoint) ?
076                    nameVals[index + 1] : nameVals[index];
077            }
078            return emptyName;
079        }
080    }
081
082    private Entities() {
083    }
084
085    /**
086     * Check if the input is a known named entity
087     *
088     * @param name the possible entity name (e.g. "lt" or "amp")
089     * @return true if a known named entity
090     */
091    public static boolean isNamedEntity(final String name) {
092        return extended.codepointForName(name) != empty;
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Check if the input is a known named entity in the base entity set.
097     *
098     * @param name the possible entity name (e.g. "lt" or "amp")
099     * @return true if a known named entity in the base set
100     * @see #isNamedEntity(String)
101     */
102    public static boolean isBaseNamedEntity(final String name) {
103        return base.codepointForName(name) != empty;
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Get the character(s) represented by the named entity
108     *
109     * @param name entity (e.g. "lt" or "amp")
110     * @return the string value of the character(s) represented by this entity, or "" if not defined
111     */
112    public static String getByName(String name) {
113        String val = multipoints.get(name);
114        if (val != null)
115            return val;
116        int codepoint = extended.codepointForName(name);
117        if (codepoint != empty)
118            return new String(new int[]{codepoint}, 0, 1);
119        return emptyName;
120    }
121
122    public static int codepointsForName(final String name, final int[] codepoints) {
123        String val = multipoints.get(name);
124        if (val != null) {
125            codepoints[0] = val.codePointAt(0);
126            codepoints[1] = val.codePointAt(1);
127            return 2;
128        }
129        int codepoint = extended.codepointForName(name);
130        if (codepoint != empty) {
131            codepoints[0] = codepoint;
132            return 1;
133        }
134        return 0;
135    }
136
137    /**
138     HTML escape an input string. That is, {@code <} is returned as {@code &lt;}. The escaped string is suitable for use
139     both in attributes and in text data.
140     @param data the un-escaped string to escape
141     @param out the output settings to use. This configures the character set escaped against (that is, if a
142     character is supported in the output character set, it doesn't have to be escaped), and also HTML or XML
143     settings.
144     @return the escaped string
145     */
146    public static String escape(String data, OutputSettings out) {
147        return escapeString(data, out.escapeMode(), out.syntax(), out.charset());
148    }
149
150    /**
151     HTML escape an input string, using the default settings (UTF-8, base entities, HTML syntax). That is, {@code <} is
152     returned as {@code &lt;}. The escaped string is suitable for use both in attributes and in text data.
153     @param data the un-escaped string to escape
154     @return the escaped string
155     @see #escape(String, OutputSettings)
156     */
157    public static String escape(String data) {
158        return escapeString(data, base, Syntax.html, DataUtil.UTF_8);
159    }
160
161    private static String escapeString(String data, EscapeMode escapeMode, Syntax syntax, Charset charset) {
162        if (data == null)
163            return "";
164        StringBuilder accum = StringUtil.borrowBuilder();
165        try {
166            doEscape(data, accum, escapeMode, syntax, charset, ForText | ForAttribute);
167        } catch (IOException e) {
168            throw new SerializationException(e); // doesn't happen
169        }
170        return StringUtil.releaseBuilder(accum);
171    }
172
173
174    static void escape(Appendable accum, String data, OutputSettings out, int options) throws IOException {
175        doEscape(data, accum, out.escapeMode(), out.syntax(), out.charset(), options);
176    }
177
178    private static void doEscape(String data, Appendable accum, EscapeMode mode, Syntax syntax, Charset charset, int options) throws IOException {
179        final CoreCharset coreCharset = CoreCharset.byName(charset.name());
180        final CharsetEncoder fallback = encoderFor(charset);
181        final int length = data.length();
182
183        int codePoint;
184        boolean lastWasWhite = false;
185        boolean reachedNonWhite = false;
186        boolean skipped = false;
187        for (int offset = 0; offset < length; offset += Character.charCount(codePoint)) {
188            codePoint = data.codePointAt(offset);
189
190            if ((options & Normalise) != 0) {
191                if (StringUtil.isWhitespace(codePoint)) {
192                    if ((options & TrimLeading) != 0 && !reachedNonWhite) continue;
193                    if (lastWasWhite) continue;
194                    if ((options & TrimTrailing) != 0) {
195                        skipped = true;
196                        continue;
197                    }
198                    accum.append(' ');
199                    lastWasWhite = true;
200                    continue;
201                } else {
202                    lastWasWhite = false;
203                    reachedNonWhite = true;
204                    if (skipped) {
205                        accum.append(' '); // wasn't the end, so need to place a normalized space
206                        skipped = false;
207                    }
208                }
209            }
210            appendEscaped(codePoint, accum, options, mode, syntax, coreCharset, fallback);
211        }
212    }
213
214    private static void appendEscaped(int codePoint, Appendable accum, int options, EscapeMode escapeMode,
215        Syntax syntax, CoreCharset coreCharset, CharsetEncoder fallback) throws IOException {
216
217        // surrogate pairs, split implementation for efficiency on single char common case (saves creating strings, char[]):
218        final char c = (char) codePoint;
219        if (codePoint < Character.MIN_SUPPLEMENTARY_CODE_POINT) {
220            // html specific and required escapes:
221            switch (c) {
222                case '&':
223                    accum.append("&amp;");
224                    break;
225                case 0xA0:
226                    appendNbsp(accum, escapeMode);
227                    break;
228                case '<':
229                    // escape when in character data or when in a xml attribute val or XML syntax; not needed in html attr val
230                    appendLt(accum, options, escapeMode, syntax);
231                    break;
232                case '>':
233                    if ((options & ForText) != 0) accum.append("&gt;");
234                    else accum.append(c);
235                    break;
236                case '"':
237                    if ((options & ForAttribute) != 0) accum.append("&quot;");
238                    else accum.append(c);
239                    break;
240                case '\'':
241                    // special case for the Entities.escape(string) method when we are maximally escaping. Otherwise, because we output attributes in "", there's no need to escape.
242                    appendApos(accum, options, escapeMode);
243                    break;
244                // we escape ascii control <x20 (other than tab, line-feed, carriage return) for XML compliance (required) and HTML ease of reading (not required) - https://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#charsets
245                case 0x9:
246                case 0xA:
247                case 0xD:
248                    accum.append(c);
249                    break;
250                default:
251                    if (c < 0x20 || !canEncode(coreCharset, c, fallback)) appendEncoded(accum, escapeMode, codePoint);
252                    else accum.append(c);
253            }
254        } else {
255            if (canEncode(coreCharset, c, fallback)) {
256                // reads into charBuf - we go through these steps to avoid GC objects as much as possible (would be a new String and a new char[2] for each character)
257                char[] chars = charBuf.get();
258                int len = Character.toChars(codePoint, chars, 0);
259                if (accum instanceof StringBuilder) // true unless the user supplied their own
260                    ((StringBuilder) accum).append(chars, 0, len);
261                else
262                    accum.append(new String(chars, 0, len));
263            } else {
264                appendEncoded(accum, escapeMode, codePoint);
265            }
266        }
267    }
268
269    private static final ThreadLocal<char[]> charBuf = ThreadLocal.withInitial(() -> new char[2]);
270
271    private static void appendNbsp(Appendable accum, EscapeMode escapeMode) throws IOException {
272        if (escapeMode != EscapeMode.xhtml) accum.append("&nbsp;");
273        else accum.append("&#xa0;");
274    }
275
276    private static void appendLt(Appendable accum, int options, EscapeMode escapeMode, Syntax syntax) throws IOException {
277        if ((options & ForText) != 0 || escapeMode == EscapeMode.xhtml || syntax == Syntax.xml) accum.append("&lt;");
278        else accum.append('<'); // no need to escape < when in an HTML attribute
279    }
280
281    private static void appendApos(Appendable accum, int options, EscapeMode escapeMode) throws IOException {
282        if ((options & ForAttribute) != 0 && (options & ForText) != 0) {
283            if (escapeMode == EscapeMode.xhtml) accum.append("&#x27;");
284            else accum.append("&apos;");
285        } else {
286            accum.append('\'');
287        }
288    }
289
290    private static void appendEncoded(Appendable accum, EscapeMode escapeMode, int codePoint) throws IOException {
291        final String name = escapeMode.nameForCodepoint(codePoint);
292        if (!emptyName.equals(name)) // ok for identity check
293            accum.append('&').append(name).append(';');
294        else
295            accum.append("&#x").append(Integer.toHexString(codePoint)).append(';');
296    }
297
298    /**
299     * Un-escape an HTML escaped string. That is, {@code &lt;} is returned as {@code <}.
300     *
301     * @param string the HTML string to un-escape
302     * @return the unescaped string
303     */
304    public static String unescape(String string) {
305        return unescape(string, false);
306    }
307
308    /**
309     * Unescape the input string.
310     *
311     * @param string to un-HTML-escape
312     * @param strict if "strict" (that is, requires trailing ';' char, otherwise that's optional)
313     * @return unescaped string
314     */
315    static String unescape(String string, boolean strict) {
316        return Parser.unescapeEntities(string, strict);
317    }
318
319    /*
320     * Provides a fast-path for Encoder.canEncode, which drastically improves performance on Android post JellyBean.
321     * After KitKat, the implementation of canEncode degrades to the point of being useless. For non ASCII or UTF,
322     * performance may be bad. We can add more encoders for common character sets that are impacted by performance
323     * issues on Android if required.
324     *
325     * Benchmarks:     *
326     * OLD toHtml() impl v New (fastpath) in millis
327     * Wiki: 1895, 16
328     * CNN: 6378, 55
329     * Alterslash: 3013, 28
330     * Jsoup: 167, 2
331     */
332    private static boolean canEncode(final CoreCharset charset, final char c, final CharsetEncoder fallback) {
333        // todo add more charset tests if impacted by Android's bad perf in canEncode
334        switch (charset) {
335            case ascii:
336                return c < 0x80;
337            case utf:
338                return !(c >= Character.MIN_SURROGATE && c < (Character.MAX_SURROGATE + 1)); // !Character.isSurrogate(c); but not in Android 10 desugar
339            default:
340                return fallback.canEncode(c);
341        }
342    }
343
344    enum CoreCharset {
345        ascii, utf, fallback;
346
347        static CoreCharset byName(final String name) {
348            if (name.equals("US-ASCII"))
349                return ascii;
350            if (name.startsWith("UTF-")) // covers UTF-8, UTF-16, et al
351                return utf;
352            return fallback;
353        }
354    }
355
356    // cache the last used fallback encoder to save recreating on every use
357    private static final ThreadLocal<CharsetEncoder> LocalEncoder = new ThreadLocal<>();
358    private static CharsetEncoder encoderFor(Charset charset) {
359        CharsetEncoder encoder = LocalEncoder.get();
360        if (encoder == null || !encoder.charset().equals(charset)) {
361            encoder = charset.newEncoder();
362            LocalEncoder.set(encoder);
363        }
364        return encoder;
365    }
366
367    private static void load(EscapeMode e, String pointsData, int size) {
368        e.nameKeys = new String[size];
369        e.codeVals = new int[size];
370        e.codeKeys = new int[size];
371        e.nameVals = new String[size];
372
373        int i = 0;
374        CharacterReader reader = new CharacterReader(pointsData);
375        try {
376            while (!reader.isEmpty()) {
377                // NotNestedLessLess=10913,824;1887&
378
379                final String name = reader.consumeTo('=');
380                reader.advance();
381                final int cp1 = Integer.parseInt(reader.consumeToAny(codeDelims), codepointRadix);
382                final char codeDelim = reader.current();
383                reader.advance();
384                final int cp2;
385                if (codeDelim == ',') {
386                    cp2 = Integer.parseInt(reader.consumeTo(';'), codepointRadix);
387                    reader.advance();
388                } else {
389                    cp2 = empty;
390                }
391                final String indexS = reader.consumeTo('&');
392                final int index = Integer.parseInt(indexS, codepointRadix);
393                reader.advance();
394
395                e.nameKeys[i] = name;
396                e.codeVals[i] = cp1;
397                e.codeKeys[index] = cp1;
398                e.nameVals[index] = name;
399
400                if (cp2 != empty) {
401                    multipoints.put(name, new String(new int[]{cp1, cp2}, 0, 2));
402                }
403                i++;
404            }
405
406            Validate.isTrue(i == size, "Unexpected count of entities loaded");
407        } finally {
408            reader.close();
409        }
410    }
411}
